data.title: Academic Funding Opportunities
data.meta_description: We offer awards for cystic fibrosis research and for professional development and training. Below is a list of current and upcoming funding opportunities.
data.text:
Purpose: To provide the opportunity for clinically trained physicians to identify and study interventions to enhance successful self-management and related health outcomes among individuals with CF.

Funding: Up to $21,000 in direct costs plus 12% of indirect costs ($23,520 total costs) per year

Duration: Up to three years

Deadline: March

Purpose: To provide resources and planning support for proposed multi-center clinical trials that address a TIME area of interest and have the potential to result in meaningful changes to the current treatment paradigm.

Funding: Up to $125,000 per year, plus an additional 12% indirect costs

Duration: One year

Deadline: January 2024

Purpose: To use innovative registry-based analyses that aim to test novel methods to advance the use of the Foundation's Patient Registry.

Funding: Up to $150,000 per year for up to two years, plus an additional 12% indirect costs.

Duration: Two years

Deadlines: Letter of Intent: August 9, 2023; full application: November 14, 2023

Purpose: To provide support for multi-investigator research projects that have the potential to make an important contribution to health equity in the CF population.

Funding: Up to $200,000 per year for up to four years, plus an additional 12% indirect costs per year. The lead institution may request up to $50,000 in additional direct costs per year to support an administrative core.

Duration: Four years

Deadlines: LOI April 2024, full application September 2024

Purpose: To provide support for multi-investigator-initiated clinical research projects that have the potential to make an important contribution to the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation’s mission.

Funding: Each applicant may request up to $200,000 per year for up to three years + an additional 12% indirect costs per year; lead institution may request up to $25,000 in additional direct costs per year

Duration: 3 years

Deadlines: LOI April, full application August

Purpose: To solicit and fund projects that will improve our understanding of the biological basis for the development and progression of gastrointestinal manifestations in cystic fibrosis as well as to identify potential novel therapeutic strategies to manage and treat them

Funding: Up to $150,000 per year + up to 12% indirect costs

Duration: 3 years

Deadline: December

Purpose: To facilitate research that will contribute to the development of new therapies or therapeutic strategies to treat cystic fibrosis with an emphasis on advancing CFTR gene repair and replacement approaches.

Funding: May not exceed $1 million/year + 12% indirect costs

Duration: 3 years

Deadline: July

Purpose: To provide bridge funding for CF-relevant R01 (or equivalent) applications that were submitted to NIH (or other governmental agencies) that scored in the 40th percentile but were not awarded by the funding agency.

Funding: $125,000/year (indirect costs not allowed)

Duration: Up to 2 years or until NIH funding is secured

Deadline: Rolling

Purpose: To introduce residents to research through participation in a CF-relevant research project with the goal to develop and maintain interest in a career in CF research or as a CF care provider.

Funding: $10,000 for one year

Duration: 1 year

Deadline: November 15, 2023

Purpose: To enable training in new research areas and methods to advance the scientific knowledge of the applicant and to collect data to enable their transition into an impactful research career.

Funding: Up to $75,000 in the first year and up to $76,000 in the second year (indirect costs not allowed)

Duration: 2 years

Deadline: December

Purpose: To support postdoctoral research fellows pursuing non-Path to a Cure related research during their fellowship and aid in their transition to an independent research faculty position.

Funding: Up to $86,000 per year during the training phase of the award. The faculty phase includes $80,000 for salary support and $30,000 for research support. (Indirect costs not allowed.)

Duration: 3 – 5 years

Deadline: December

Purpose: The intent of this program is to support fellowship programs that integrate CF care and mentorship early in their fellowship curriculum.

Funding: $78,000, which includes up to $72,000 for salary and benefits and $2,000 each for travel and/or registration fees for three fellows to attend NACFC

Duration: One year

Deadline: September 2024

Purpose: To encourage outstanding newly trained internists and pediatricians to enhance clinical proficiency in CF-related subspecialties and to develop the necessary research capabilities to become independent biomedical investigators.

Funding: Ranges from $65,000 stipend plus $11,000 research and development for first year to $100,000 stipend plus $31,000 research and development for sixth year (indirect costs not allowed)

Duration: 3-6 years

Deadline: February

Purpose: To enable promising early-career physician scientists seeking additional research mentoring outside of their home academic institutions to enhance their clinical or translational research proficiency and support their development of the necessary clinical research capabilities to become independent investigators.

Funding: Up to $42,420 per year

Duration: 3 years

Deadline: May

Purpose: To support excellent CF-focused researchers whose projects have been submitted to and approved by the NIH but cannot be supported by available funds.

Funding: $80,000 per year (indirect costs not allowed)

Duration: Up to 2 years or until NIH funding is secured

Deadline: January 1 to November 3

Purpose: To provide supplemental funding to qualified and promising scientists early in their faculty careers who have obtained K funding from the National Institutes of Health in areas that reflect the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation's research priorities.

Funding: $50,000 (indirect costs not allowed)

Duration: Up to 5 years/duration of the NIH K-award

Deadline: Rolling

Purpose: To enable outstanding early career pediatricians and internists to enhance their clinical research proficiency and to develop the necessary clinical research capabilities to become independent investigators who formulate and lead multi-center, clinical research studies.

Funding: Up to $40,740 per year (plus travel)

Duration: 3 years

Deadlines: LOI March, full application June

Purpose: This award will promote greater collaborative integration of statisticians and CF clinical investigators at TDN institutions by funding local statisticians and integrating them into the CF Statistical Research Network (CF StatNet).

Funding: Year 1, 35% FTE; Year 2, 25% FTE; Year 3, 20% FTE

Duration: Three years

Deadline: LOI August 2024, full application December 2024

Purpose: For research projects that aim to use available clinical trials in organ transplantation specimens and/or clinical data to improve knowledge of chronic lung allograft dysfunction (CLAD) pathogenesis and explore new approaches to detection, prevention, monitoring, or treatment of CLAD.

Funding: Between $50,000 to $100,000 per year for up to two years plus 12% indirect costs

Duration: 2 years

Deadlines: LOI: June 13, 2024; Full application: September 12, 2024

Purpose: For research projects that aim to identify biomarkers, improve knowledge of pathogenesis, and explore new approaches to treatment of chronic lung allograft dysfunction (CLAD).

Funding: Up to $150,000 per year for up to two years, plus an additional 12% indirect costs for independent research; and up to $350,000 per year for up to two years, plus 12% indirect costs for collaborative research.

Duration: 2 years

Deadlines: LOI: May 21, 2024; Full application: August 15, 2024

Purpose: Quality improvement (QI) awards for projects designed to improve the early diagnosis of CF through the newborn screening system and/or to improve the initial management of infants with positive screening tests and the follow-up communications with their families.

Funding: $75,000 per year for 2 years (plus 12% indirect costs)

Duration: 2 years

Deadline: July
